Each whisk is made from one piece of bamboo, with a fascinating method of splitting the bamboo along its grain/fiber- the durable and flexible, brush-like tip aerates the liquid as you whisk, creating a fine, silky smooth matcha. It is said that there are only about 15 chasen craftsmen in Japan today- among those, Takayama chasen is crafted by extremely skillful hands, making it an long-lasting, excellent tool trusted by many. ※The manufacturer's prices are being revised effective 2025/9/11

title: Yasukiyo Wooden Dripper - URUSHI
description: The Yasukiyo Wooden Dripper is beautifully handcrafted using the Yamanaka-shikki lacquerware method, resulting in a product of both intricate design and lasting quality. This "Urushi" series is the high-end range of their wooden dripper. Lacquer coating technique have been an essential part oh Japanese culture, being used in many items such as tablewares, trays, stationaries, boxes, furnitures, and so on. By going through 30-40 stages of manufacturing process including numerous layers of coating, lacquer coating not only makes the item durable but turns it into an art form. The intricately-carved latitudinal ribs contain the water within the dripper for the perfect amount of time, extracting all of the nuanced flavors and aromas from the coffee within.

title: Coffee & Cycling Map in Kyoto
description: Biking is a common way of transport here in Kyoto. Everyday at Kurasu we welcome customers visiting us by bike, darting the street to grab a cup of coffee. We are proud to be serving specialty coffee in a city where the old and new coffee culture coexist, being a part of the colors that make the city beautiful like one big painting. Kyoto is a small city and not all of the great spots in Kyoto are located in the central. Which is why biking is a wonderful way of visiting those places which is difficult to reach via public transport and are a bit far away to walk to. At every corner and on every little alley, the historical city of Kyoto have so much more to offer than what is mentioned on a tidy, grid patterned map on a guide book. With this map, that we made to share all the hidden gems for good coffee - we hope your bike will take you to all the cool spots in Kyoto you've never seen before.

title: TORCH Little Glass
description: Teeny-Tiny but Sturdy: A Thick, Heat-Proof Glass That Adds a Little Joy to Your Coffee Break A lovely little glass from the beloved TORCH, that holds cold drinks, hot drinks, and microwavable- it's so versatile it will soon become your staple on your table throughout the year. title: ORIGAMI Coffee Paper Filter Wave
description: A Dream Fit for ORIGAMI Dripper The ORIGAMI Wave Filter comes with narrow ridges that fit ORIGAMI’s iconic 20 ribs perfectly. The good fit of the paper filter to the ribs of the dripper makes the gap between the dripper and filter smaller, and prevents water from escaping from the sides, resulting in higher extraction efficiency and a robust flavor even with shorter brewing time. The controlled water flow through the coffee bed makes a clean cup with sweetness and a good body. Unlike that of conical filter, the flat-bottom wave type filter creates a coffee bed with thinner and even thickness, which lets water through in shorter time with little difference of extraction level between the upper layer of the coffee bed and the bottom- keys to a stable extraction.

title: Kurasu Coffee Canister by Kato-Seisakusho
description: We are so happy to share our new Kurasu Original Coffee Canister with you all- after so much love we received for our previous model for being airtight with inner lid and overall great quality, we partnered with the same team at Kato Seisakusho to make another great little item to store your favorite coffee beans. The manufacturer, Kato Seisakusho, is a long-established tea canister maker crafting quality ware since 1895 in Asakusa, Tokyo. They spray paint each cans by hand, then fire them in 120-130℃ kiln before printing our original design on, which makes the paint coat deep and sleek, while having the warmth of hand-crafted piece. The canister holds a good 250g of coffee beans- the minimal, quality piece not only keeps your coffee fresh but also makes your coffee experience even more elevated and joyful.
